title: Smart search
content:
You can customize the following smart search settings to pre-define the possible actions based on your search conditions and results in Agent Interface (Administration > Configuration > AI Studio > Smart Search).

Enable phrase queries

This setting allows you to automatically add quotations to the search criteria. By default, this setting is disabled.

An exact phrase search follows these rules:

  • remove stop words from the query phrase
  • is case-insensitive
  • match the exact form of all the terms
  • match the terms in the specified order

For example:

Searching for the phrase phones and laptops returns the same search results as these phrases:

  • phones laptops because the stop word "and" is removed.
  • Phones and Laptops because the search is case-insensitive.

Searching for the phrase phones and laptops returns different search results from these phrases:

  • phone and laptop because the search only matches the exact form, not the stem form of terms.
  • laptops and phones because the search only matches the terms in the specific order that you specify.

Ignore certain special characters

Enabling this setting allows smart search to interpret special elements as normal characters instead of a query syntax. These elements include asterisks (*), question marks (?), colons (:), double quotation marks ("), brackets, boolean, and proximity operators such as AND, NOT, OR, EOR, XOR, NEAR, DNEAR, WNEAR, BEFORE, and AFTER. Select this check box to disable wildcards, phrase queries, field restrictions, and boolean operations.

By default, this setting is disabled.

If you select this check box, the system ignores the setting of Enable phrase queries and doesn't add quotations to the query text.

For example:

If this setting is enabled, searching for the phrase mobile AND phone displays search results that contain either mobile or phone.

If this setting is disabled, searching for the phrase mobile AND phone displays search results that contain both mobile and phone.

Minimum search result relevance threshold (0-100)

This setting defines the minimum relevance percentage that search results must meet in relation to the query. The default value is 30.

The value must be between 0 and 100. Negative numbers or any numbers that are greater than 100 aren't allowed.

Currently, this setting applies only to the global search in Service Portal. For global search in Agent Interface, the value is fixed at 30.
